artifact_name: cup type a(possibly); cup type b(possibly)
Description: Lower body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, Type A or B; interior black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of female figure or maenad (only legs and lower part of chiton remaining; with added white on legs), to right; below, two dilute lines and top of black area.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 92 no. 316 pl. 68)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1438) (phase 3)
